alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:33AM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Quick-hitting Winter Storm to bring Tricky Travel Conditions in Trinity County on Tuesday... ...Heavy Snowfall Expected Above 3500 feet in Trinity County Late Wednesday and Thursday... .The first in several rounds of precipitation expected to impact northwest California through the holiday weekend will arrive in Trinity County Tuesday. Snow levels will start around 2500 feet and rise to around 3500 feet overnight. A dusting is possible at locations as low as Weaverville, but most light snow will fall above 3000 feet. Precipitation will taper off early Wednesday. Snow levels are expected to be mainly above 4000 feet with the next round of precipitation late Wednesday into Thursday, before much colder air begins flowing in late Thursday through the weekend. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2500 feet, wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 3500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM to 10 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult over mountain passes along Highways 299, 36, and especially 3. Plan on slippery and potentially snow- covered roads. Chains may be required over some mountain passes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
